newsitem.title: UK: BT telemarket centres to create 2,000 UK jobs.
newsitem.headline: BT telemarket centres to create 2,000 UK jobs.

text.p: British Telecommunications Plc said on Monday it planned to open two telemarketing centres, creating some 2,000 jobs in the north of England.
The telecoms giant, which is set to merge with U.S. group MCI Communications Corp, said the centres would cost about 15 million stg each.
The centres, in Doncaster, South Yorkshire, and on North Tyneside, will open in the autumn.

"We believe it is vital to get closer to our customers by regular phone contact so that we can understand them better...Our teams at Doncaster and North Tyneside will help us achieve this," BT said in a statement.
BT also planned a "significant" expansion of its existing telemarketing operations in Glasgow.
The expansion will involve relocation to a new site in the city.
BT's shares firmed 4.0 pence to 433 by 0920 GMT.
